summary: This is a court order from the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, dated September 11, 2020. It orders the United States to submit an amicus brief regarding arguments raised by Ghislaine Maxwell and her motion to consolidate appeals, and adjourns a scheduled hearing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central defendant in the appeal, whose arguments and motion to consolidate are the subject of the court's order for an amicus brief.

persons.name: Loretta A. Preska
persons.context: Presiding judge (J.) for the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York case referenced (S.D.N.Y. 20-2413).

persons.name: Catherine O'Hagan Wolfe
persons.context: Clerk of Court for the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, who signed the order on behalf of the court.

persons.name: Sharon Churcher
persons.context: Listed as a respondent in the case caption of the appeal.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as a deceased respondent in the case caption of the appeal.

persons.name: Julie Brown
persons.context: Listed as an intervenor in the case, likely a journalist given the association with Miami Herald Media Company.

persons.name: Alan M. Dershowitz
persons.context: Listed as an intervenor in the case, a prominent attorney.

persons.name: Michael Cemovich
persons.context: Listed as an intervenor doing business as Cemovich Media.

connections.description: Both are central figures in the underlying criminal case, with Maxwell being the defendant-appellant and Epstein listed as a respondent.
Both are parties (defendant and intervenor) in the same appellate case, indicating Dershowitz has a legal interest in the proceedings.
Listed together as intervenors, strongly suggesting Brown is a journalist for the Miami Herald.

events.title: Adjourned Hearing
events.description: A court hearing originally scheduled for September 22, 2020, at 2:00 pm was adjourned until further order of the court.

events.title: Amicus Brief Deadline
events.description: The United States was ordered to submit an amicus letter brief regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's arguments and motion to consolidate appeals.

events.title: Response Deadline
events.description: The parties to the appeal were ordered to respond to the United States' amicus brief.

locations: Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY
keyFacts: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit ordered the United States to file an amicus brief regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's appellate arguments and her motion to consolidate her appeal with another case (United States v. Maxwell, No. 20-3061).
The order lists several intervenors in the appeal, including journalist Julie Brown (Miami Herald), attorney Alan Dershowitz, and Michael Cemovich (Cemovich Media).
A scheduled hearing for September 22, 2020, was adjourned indefinitely by this order.
